rules

a) ethics and etiquette

i) all the global rules and guidelines hold in this game, and are not duplicated below. make sure you know what they prohibit.
ii) never link to or quote from any QuickTopic provided by the mod, or from hydra QuickTopics. loose paraphrasing should be fine.
iii) excessive coarse language should not be directed at other players. frustration is natural, but keep it in check.
iv) cryptography and steganography are strictly forbidden.
v) if you have outside information which alters your knowledge of the game or suspect the game has been compromised, contact the mod immediately.
vi) if you are not sure whether an action you take could break these rules, err on the side of caution and privately contact the mod to find out.

b) life, death, and lynching mechanics

i) your vote or unvote is valid so long as it contains the word 'vote' or 'unvote' directly followed by a player's name or 'no lynch', all in instantly readable unquoted bold text.
ii) abbreviations or misspellings of a player's name or 'no lynch' are valid whilst voting, so long as they are unambiguous.
iii) a lynch occurs when a player receives greater than 50% of all votes.
iv) a no lynch occurs when greater than or equal to 50% of all votes are placed in favour. the game will progress to night without a lynch.
v) further votes and unvotes are invalid after a lynch or no lynch occurs.
vi) players are not allowed to post once they have died through lynch or kill, including 'bah' posts.
vii) votes and unvotes are invalid if they come from any account not listed as alive and presently in the game.
viii) if you are not sure whether a vote is or will be valid, err on the side of caution and privately contact the mod to find out.

c) activity, deadlines, and action submission

i) the length of a Day phase is 14 days.
ii) night phases last 72 hours, but can be ended at the mod's discretion if all night actions are in and no player requests Night last its full length.
iii) deadlines are extended only in exceptional circumstances or if a player needs replacement. no phase ends until all playerslots are occupied.
iv) if the Day deadline expires without a majority of votes on a player, nobody dies and the game moves into Night.
v) players may continue talking after a lynch has occurred until the mod flips the lynched player (i.e. in Twilight).
vi) if Day or Night actions are not submitted via PM or bolded in a mod-provided QT before deadline or a lynch, they do not resolve.
vii) players who do not wish to perform an available Day or Night action should submit 'no action'.
viii) players who do not post for 48 hours will be prodded. not responding to a prod within 24 hours or receiving 4 prods will see a player being replaced.
ix) if a player expects to be unable to post for upwards of 48 hours, they should declare V/LA legibly, in bold, in-thread, to avoid being prodded.
x) keep in mind that being inactive disrupts the mod's and other players' enjoyment of the game and darkens their view of you.

d) miscellaneous

i) when in doubt, ask the mod.
ii) actions are resolved according to Natural Action Resolution.
iii) do not impersonate or attempt to impersonate the mod.
iv) don't exploit technicalities or poor wording in the rules to do something you should know is forbidden and unethical.
v) punishment for breaking the rules is determined on a case-by-case basis, and may range from a warning to a modkill or force replacement.
vi) pretending to break these rules will incur the same punishment as actually breaking them.
vii) the mod reserves the right to add, modify, or remove rules as necessary, but will not change relevant rules during or after the fact.

setup

the only thing you know about this setup is that it passed normalcy and balance reviews.

this is the vanilla townie role pm:

welcome to mini 1410: mafia in the unknown, [playername]!

===

you are a vanilla townie.

you have no special abilities, but you can post and use your one vote in thread.

your win condition is as follows:
>>> you win if all non-town aligned players are eliminated and at least one town aligned player is alive.

===

you must confirm by replying to this PM with your role name and alignment.

the game thread is here. good luck, and have fun!

pregame begins now and ends once all players confirm

number of confirmed players: 12
changed some of the rules slightly in response to a player's questions about twilight (c) iv) and v))

What I know is true:
- I am town.
- There is at least one player in this game who is not aligned with the town. Reasoning: If we were all town, the game would be over.
- There are more town than non-town. Reasoning: If there were more non-town then town, the game would be over.

What I assume to be true:
- There are at least two non-town players in this game. Reasoning: Most, if not all, Mini Normal games played on this site have had at least two non-town players.
- At this unbiased point in the game, each player that is not me has at least a 17% chance of being non-town. Reasoning: If I assume that at least two players are non-town, and I know I am town, then that makes at least 2 out of 12 players non-town. 2/12 = 1/6 = ~17%.

However, there is no inequality at this point, so a random vote is the best, as it prohibits bias in my own choice. So going down the playerlist as seen in the first post, and omitting my own username, I will vote for the player whose number comes up on a 12-sided die.

Original Roll String: 1d12
1 12-Sided Dice: (11) = 11

Hm, I think that's worth checking out more thoroughly, rofl. So what do we know so far? (Warning: Wall of text incoming.)

Rev has a confirmed neighborizing ability, which makes him most likely town. I don't know the numbers on town neighborizers vs. scum neighborizers but I do think it's fair to say that he is almost certainly town-aligned. I don't think that Rev would recruit a scumbuddy the first night, making it even more unlikely that there is a Rev+CooLDoG team. I'd say that if Rev is town, CooLDoG would definitely get townie points.

CooLDoG's ability is not confirmed, as he only claimed his investigation on Edos AFTER he had Edos claim, and he did not say he was blocked until after Edos claimed JK. Neighbors, did CooLDoG ever talk about or hint at his role in the thread? If not, the truth of it is still debatable. If his ability does become confirmed, then I would say he is even more certainly town than Rev, but it's not. It's dangerous to act as if someone is confirmed when they're not. We shouldn't let people just coast until endgame...which may be very soon at hand if we screw this up...when they could conceivably be stringing us along.

I would say that the only way that Edos could be scum would be if CooLDoG is also scum. It would be very risky to fakeclaim a jailkeep on someone who is still alive and whose role is not known to be vanilla town. If CooLDoG is his mafia partner, then fine, they could be in on the ploy together, but I find that supremely unlikely.

Of all the possible combinations, I would say that the most likely of them would be that CooLDoG alone is scum, followed by Revenus alone. Edos is the least likely to be scum in my opinion, and is only scum if CooLDoG is scum. The only thing I see that is scummy about any of their behavior is that CooLDoG's explanation as to why he wanted Edos to claim made no sense...unless he thought he was some sort of no-kill mafia doctor or traitor role? Eh, it still doesn't make sense. If you see hoofprints, think horses, not zebras. (I think Revenus' unwillingness to claim is silly given that we are supposed to be massclaiming today, but I don't think it's scum behavior.) CooLDoG is maybe somebody to maybe look at tomorrow if we make it through mylo. I know I personally have been overlooking him as obvtown but I don't think we can afford to let anyone slide who isn't confirmed at this point.

So yeah. tl;dr version: No one is 100% confirmed. Edos is almost certainly town and is only even conceivably scum if CooLDoG is also scum. I'd say 95% likely to be town. CooLDoG is probably about 75% confirmed by his believable sounding roleclaim alone but his actions toward Edos cast some doubt...maybe bumping it down to around 70%. Rev is probably hanging at 85% town for a commonly pro-town role. Rev and CooLDoG are probably not mafia partners. Don't lynch any of them today, but if there's one of them (and only one) to look at tomorrow, it's CooLDoG.

The Town have won! The Mafia and Serial Killer are defeated.
This game is now over. Role distribution, setup reveal, night actions, and mod comments are to be revealed.

Game Reveal

See this QuickTopic for role distribution, role PMs, QuickTopic links, and Day and Night actions.

Mod Comments

Firstly, congratulations to the Town, and commiserations to the Mafia and Serial Killer. Both anti-town factions played very strong games, but Town were onto you by the end. Thanks to all the original players who stayed in through the whole game (Cheery Dog, Edosurist, CooLDoG, Revenus, Zhero, roflcopter, and RestFermata), and thanks to all those who replaced in and finished the game (Konowa, captaineddie, havingfitz, I Am Innocent, Norlkaz, and DrippingGoofball).

The game was hanging in the balance in Day 4: if Revenus had been hammered and roflcopter not targeted by a kill from the Mafia, he would essentially hold the game in his hands in the 1v1v1 LYLO (he would have to shoot captaineddie, but not Zhero, to win). Unfortunately, the lynch swung onto roflcopter instead.

The setup, in my opinion, turned out very nicely indeed. My aim was to make it a low-power Normal, but one which held a certain degree of intrigue, which would keep players interested, and I think I succeeded (although as my reviewers will attest, it took a gruelling few months to work the setup out). I was very happy that I got comments from people via PM praising me on the setup. A good indicator that it was balanced is that it ended up making it to 3p LYLO despite no power roles dying until very late. So there were no broken role interactions, either.

Thanks for making this a fun, interesting game to mod and, hopefully, to play. See you next time!
